document.docAuthor: Brandão, Marianna, Coelho-Filho, Petronio Alves & Tavares, Marcos
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the genus Speocarcinus Stimpson, 1859 (Crustacea: Brachyura: Xanthidae), with a key to its species and the description of one new species

Type locality.
Brazil , Rio Grande do Sul,
32 ° 17 'S
–
50 ° 48 'W
,
82 m .

Remarks. In some small males and females individuals of
S. meloi
the carapace anterolateral teeth may be very low and almost indistinct; the first (exorbital) and the second anterolateral teeth may be coalesced into a single lobe or fused basally only, in which case the exorbital tooth is acute, whereas the second anterolateral tooth is rounded at tip; the granulation density in the pterygostomian region is somewhat variable. The punctations and the rows of setae in the P 1 propodus are more evident in small individuals than in larger ones.

Contrary to
Brandão et al . ( 2010 )
the anterior margin of the sterno-abdominal cavity in
S. meloi
(fig. 5 E) is more densely granular than in
S. amazonicus
(fig. 5 A).

Distribution. Brazil (Alagoas, Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo and Rio Grande do Sul), in muddy sand bottoms, at depths between 21 and
122 m .
